newsitem.title: USA: NYPA sees Indian Pt 3 nuclear unit back in a week.
newsitem.headline: NYPA sees Indian Pt 3 nuclear unit back in a week.

text.p: New York Power Authority (NYPA) said Monday it expects to restore power production at its 965 megawatt (MW) Indian Point 3 nuclear power plant in about a week.
"We shut the plant to fix the feedwater heaters...We hope to bring (it) back perhaps by next week," a spokesman at the facility said.
The plant, at Indian Point along the Hudson River, was shut late Saturday, he said.
The heater produces steam that feeds into the unit's steam generator.
The New York Power Authority is a state agency that produces electricity for sale to utilities and municipalities in New York state.
